title: Character Analysis and Motivation

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: A person or animal in a story.
The reason why a character does something.
A quality that describes what a character is like.
Proof from the story that supports what you think.
When a character wants something inside, like to feel happy or brave.
When a character wants something outside, like a prize or to help someone.

teachingNotes: Use character analysis charts. Practice finding evidence in text. Discuss how character actions reveal personality.

sample.question: If a character shares their lunch with a hungry friend, what character trait does this show?

truefalse.question: You can learn about a character by paying attention to what they say and do.
expectedAny: character actions and dialogue reveal personality

multiplechoice.question: What motivates a character who practices piano every day?
choices: they have nothing else to do
expectedAny: they want to improve their skills
daily practice shows desire to get better

fillintheblank.question: When you make a claim about a character, you need to find _____ from the story to support your idea.

shortanswer.question: How can you figure out what motivates a character in a story?
expectedAny: pay attention to what they say
see what problems they try to solve
find text evidence of wants and needs
look at how other characters react to them
think about why they do it
